title.narrative: F.a: Facilitation of Indigenous peoples in maintaining land and livelihoods

description.narrative: Indonesia aims to remain as a major producer of crude palm oil in the world. The expansion of palm oil plantations is particularly rapid in West-Kalimantan, where hundreds of conflicts have occurred between local communities and companies. This project wil l help to improve the capacity and ability of indigenous communities in Sepauk and Tempunak sub-district of Sintang District to understand the threats that exist in their territory, to protect their remaining livelihoods, and to prepare all the data and do cuments necessary to protect their lands by using state?s protection mechanisms.Therefore, this project will organize and conduct critical education at the community level, participatory mapping, as well as handling of cases and agrarian conflicts which ha ve occurred in the field.In 2015, the project focus in two sub-districts (Sepauk and Tempunak) in Sintang district, West Kalimantan. Directly, this project will organize communities in 15 villages to protect of their customary forest areas, which account i n total approximately 20,700 hectares. Trainings will be held to members of the communities for sharing skills and knowledge to maintain and manage their livelihoods sustainably. Participatory mapping will be conducted to map the area of Dayak Seberuang, a nd a work plan will be made to manage Seberuang indigenous territory sustainably. Natural resource conflicts in the project area are also expected to be managed and resolved. Direct beneficiaries of this project are Dayak Seberuang?s indigenous people, whi ch live in the focused villages. Indirectly, this project will provide benefits to a larger community orf people living in the area. In addition to the dayak communities and WALHI Kalbar activists, the stakeholders in the project include district officials , Ministry of Forestry, local media, other NGOs, and private sector.www.walhikalbar.or.id
